query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
13 Noi andavam con li diece demoni. 14 Ahi fiera compagnia! ma ne la chiesa 15 coi santi, e in taverna coi ghiottoni.
query.result:
**English:**
13 We went with the ten demons. 14 Oh, fierce company! But in church 15 with the saints, and in the tavern with the gluttons.
**Malay:**
13 Kami berjalan dengan sepuluh iblis. 14 Oh, teman yang ganas! Tetapi di gereja 15 dengan para santo, dan di kedai minuman dengan para pelahap.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
16 Pur a la pegola era la mia ’ntesa, 17 per veder de la bolgia ogne contegno 18 e de la gente ch’entro v’era incesa.
query.result:
**English:**
16 Even though my sight was obscured by the pitch, 17 I could see every detail of the bolgia 18 and the people who were tormented within it.
**Malay:**
16 Meskipun penglihatanku terhalang oleh ter, 17 aku dapat melihat setiap detail bolgia 18 dan orang-orang yang tersiksa di dalamnya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
19 Come i dalfini, quando fanno segno 20 a’ marinar con l’arco de la schiena 21 che s’argomentin di campar lor legno,
22 talor così, ad alleggiar la pena, 23 mostrav’ alcun de’ peccatori ’l dosso 24 e nascondea in men che non balena.
query.result:
**English:**
19 Like dolphins, when they make a sign 20 to the sailors with the arch of their backs 21 that they should prepare to save their ship,
22 sometimes in this way, to lighten their pain, 23 some of the sinners would show their backs 24 and hide them again in less time than it takes a lightning bolt to flash.
**Malay:**
19 Seperti lumba-lumba, ketika mereka memberi tanda 20 kepada pelaut dengan lengkungan punggung mereka 21 bahwa mereka harus bersiap untuk menyelamatkan kapal mereka,
22 terkadang seperti ini, untuk meringankan penderitaan mereka, 23 beberapa pendosa akan menunjukkan punggung mereka 24 dan menyembunyikannya kembali dalam waktu yang lebih singkat daripada kilat menyambar.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
25 E come a l’orlo de l’acqua d’un fosso 26 stanno i ranocchi pur col muso fuori, 27 sì che celano i piedi e l’altro grosso,
28 sì stavan d’ogne parte i peccatori; 29 ma come s’appressava Barbariccia, 30 così si ritraén sotto i bollori.
query.result:
**English:**
25 And as on the edge of a ditch’s water 26 the frogs stand with only their snouts outside, 27 so that they hide their feet and the rest of their bulk,
28 so stood the sinners on every side; 29 but as Barbariccia approached, 30 so they drew back beneath the boiling.
**Malay:**
25 Dan seperti di tepi air parit 26 katak-katak itu berdiri dengan hanya moncongnya di luar, 27 sehingga mereka menyembunyikan kaki mereka dan bagian tubuh mereka yang lain,
28 begitulah para pendosa berdiri di setiap sisi; 29 tetapi ketika Barbariccia mendekat, 30 mereka mundur ke bawah air yang mendidih.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
37 I’ sapea già di tutti quanti ’l nome, 38 sì li notai quando fuorono eletti, 39 e poi ch’e’ si chiamaro, attesi come.
query.result:
**English:**
37 He already knew the names of all of them, 38 because I noted them down when they were chosen, 39 and then when they called to each other, I listened attentively.
**Malay:**
37 Dia sudah mengetahui nama-nama mereka semua, 38 karena aku mencatatnya ketika mereka dipilih, 39 dan kemudian ketika mereka memanggil satu sama lain, aku mendengarkan dengan saksama.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
40 «O Rubicante, fa che tu li metti 41 li unghioni a dosso, sì che tu lo scuoi!», 42 gridavan tutti insieme i maladetti.
query.result:
**English:**
40 "O Rubicante, make sure you set your 41 claws on his back, so that you flay him!", 42 all the damned shouted together.
**Malay:**
40 "Wahai Rubicante, pastikan kau menancapkan 41 cakarmu di punggungnya, sehingga kau mengulitinya!", 42 teriak semua orang terkutuk itu bersama-sama.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
43 E io: «Maestro mio, fa, se tu puoi, 44 che tu sappi chi è lo sciagurato 45 venuto a man de li avversari suoi».
query.result:
**English:**
43 And I: "My Master, do, if you are able, 44 so that you may know who is the wretch 45 come into the hands of his adversaries."
**Malay:**
43 Dan aku: "Guruku, lakukanlah, jika engkau mampu, 44 agar engkau tahu siapa orang celaka itu 45 yang datang ke tangan para musuhnya."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
46 Lo duca mio li s’accostò allato; 47 domandollo ond’ ei fosse, e quei rispuose: 48 «I’ fui del regno di Navarra nato.
query.result:
**English:**
46 My guide approached him; 47 he asked him where he was from, and he replied: 48 "I was born in the kingdom of Navarre.
**Malay:**
46 Pemimpinku mendekatinya; 47 menanyakan dari mana dia, dan dia menjawab: 48 "Aku lahir di kerajaan Navarra.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
49 Mia madre a servo d’un segnor mi puose, 50 che m’avea generato d’un ribaldo, 51 distruggitor di sé e di sue cose.
query.result:
**English:**
49 My mother placed me in service to a lord, 50 who had fathered me by a rascal, 51 a destroyer of himself and his possessions.
**Malay:**
49 Ibuku menempatkanku untuk melayani seorang tuan, 50 yang telah memperanakkanku dengan seorang bajingan, 51 seorang perusak dirinya sendiri dan harta miliknya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
52 Poi fui famiglia del buon re Tebaldo; 53 quivi mi misi a far baratteria, 54 di ch’io rendo ragione in questo caldo».
query.result:
**English:**
52 Then I became a member of the household of the good King Thibault; 53 there I set myself to practicing usury, 54 for which I render an account in this heat.
**Malay:**
52 Kemudian aku menjadi anggota keluarga Raja Thibault yang baik; 53 di sana aku mulai melakukan riba, 54 yang aku pertanggungjawabkan dalam panas ini.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
55 E Cirïatto, a cui di bocca uscia 56 d’ogne parte una sanna come a porco, 57 li fé sentir come l’una sdruscia.
query.result:
**English:**
55 And Ciriatto, from whose mouth there issued 56 on every side a tusk like a boar's, 57 made them feel how one of them ripped.
**Malay:**
55 Dan Ciriatto, yang dari mulutnya keluar 56 di setiap sisi taring seperti babi hutan, 57 membuat mereka merasakan bagaimana salah satunya terkoyak.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
58 Tra male gatte era venuto ’l sorco; 59 ma Barbariccia il chiuse con le braccia 60 e disse: «State in là, mentr’ io lo ’nforco».
query.result:
**English:**
58 Among evil cats the mouse had come; 59 but Barbariccia seized him with his arms 60 and said: "Stay there while I truss him up".
**Malay:**
58 Di antara kucing-kucing jahat tikus itu telah datang; 59 tetapi Barbariccia menangkapnya dengan lengannya 60 dan berkata: "Diam di sana, sementara aku mengikatnya".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
61 E al maestro mio volse la faccia; 62 «Domanda», disse, «ancor, se più disii 63 saper da lui, prima ch’altri ’l disfaccia».
query.result:
**English:**
61 And he turned his face to my master; 62 "Ask him," he said, "again, if you desire 63 to know more from him, before another destroys him."
**Malay:**
61 Dan dia memalingkan wajahnya kepada tuanku; 62 "Bertanya," katanya, "sekali lagi, jika engkau menginginkan 63 untuk mengetahui lebih banyak darinya, sebelum yang lain menghancurkannya."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
64 Lo duca dunque: «Or dì: de li altri rii 65 conosci tu alcun che sia latino 66 sotto la pece?». E quelli: «I’ mi partii,
67 poco è, da un che fu di là vicino.
query.result:
**English:**
64 The leader then said: "Now tell me, of the other wicked ones, 65 do you know any who are Latin, 66 under the pitch?" And he said: "I departed,
67 a short while ago, from one who was from near there.
**Malay:**
64 Pemimpin itu berkata: "Sekarang katakan: dari orang-orang jahat lainnya, 65 apakah kamu mengenal seseorang yang berasal dari Latin, 66 di bawah ter? Dan dia berkata: "Aku berangkat,
67 beberapa saat yang lalu, dari seseorang yang berasal dari dekat sana.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
68 Così foss’ io ancor con lui coperto, 69 ch’i’ non temerei unghia né uncino!».
70 E Libicocco «Troppo avem sofferto», 71 disse; e preseli ’l braccio col runciglio, 72 sì che, stracciando, ne portò un lacerto.
query.result:
**English:**
68 If only I were still covered with him, 69 I would not fear claw or hook!”.
70 And Libicocco said, “We have suffered too much”, 71 and he seized his arm with the grappling hook, 72 so that, tearing it, he carried off a piece of it.
**Malay:**
68 Kalau saja aku masih tertutup bersamanya, 69 aku tidak akan takut pada cakar atau pengait!”.
70 Dan Libicocco berkata, “Kita sudah terlalu banyak menderita”, 71 dan dia meraih lengannya dengan pengait, 72 sehingga, mencabiknya, dia membawa pergi sepotong lengannya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
73 Draghignazzo anco i volle dar di piglio 74 giuso a le gambe; onde ’l decurio loro 75 si volse intorno intorno con mal piglio.
query.result:
**English:**
73 Draghignazzo also wanted to grab him 74 by the legs; whereupon their overseer 75 turned around and around with an evil scowl.
**Malay:**
73 Draghignazzo juga ingin menangkapnya 74 di bagian kaki; oleh karena itu pengawas mereka 75 menoleh ke sekeliling dengan tatapan jahat.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
76 Quand’ elli un poco rappaciati fuoro, 77 a lui, ch’ancor mirava sua ferita, 78 domandò ’l duca mio sanza dimoro:
79 «Chi fu colui da cui mala partita 80 di’ che facesti per venire a proda?».
query.result:
**English:**
76 When they were somewhat pacified, 77 my guide asked him, who was still looking at his wound, 78 without delay:
79 "Tell me, who was the one from whom you made a bad departure, 80 so that you came to shore?"
**Malay:**
76 Ketika mereka agak tenang, 77 kepada dia, yang masih melihat lukanya, 78 tanpa berlama-lama pemimpinku bertanya:
79 "Katakan, siapa orang yang kau tinggalkan dengan buruk, 80 sehingga kau sampai ke pantai?"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
81 Ed ei rispuose: «Fu frate Gomita,
82 quel di Gallura, vasel d’ogne froda, 83 ch’ebbe i nemici di suo donno in mano, 84 e fé sì lor, che ciascun se ne loda.
query.result:
**English:**
81 And he replied: "It was friar Gomita,
82 he of Gallura, vessel of every fraud, 83 who had his lord's enemies in his power, 84 and did such things to them that each one praises him for it.
**Malay:**
81 Dan dia menjawab: "Itulah saudara Gomita,
82 dia dari Gallura, bejana segala tipu daya, 83 yang memiliki musuh-musuh tuannya di tangannya, 84 dan melakukan hal-hal sedemikian rupa kepada mereka sehingga masing-masing memujinya karenanya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
85 Danar si tolse e lasciolli di piano, 86 sì com’ e’ dice; e ne li altri offici anche 87 barattier fu non picciol, ma sovrano.

**English:**

**Malay:**

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.

query.result:
**English:**

**Malay:**

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
97 «Se voi volete vedere o udire», 98 ricominciò lo spaürato appresso, 99 «Toschi o Lombardi, io ne farò venire;
100 ma stieno i Malebranche un poco in cesso, 101 sì ch’ei non teman de le lor vendette; 102 e io, seggendo in questo loco stesso,
103 per un ch’io son, ne farò venir sette 104 quand’ io suffolerò, com’ è nostro uso 105 di fare allor che fori alcun si mette».
query.result:
**English:**
97 "If you wish to see or hear," 98 the frightened one began again, 99 "Tuscans or Lombards, I will make some come;
100 but let the Malebranche stand back a little, 101 so that they do not fear their vengeance; 102 and I, sitting in this same place,
103 for one that I am, I will make seven come 104 when I whistle, as is our custom 105 to do when someone puts himself outside."
**Malay:**
97 "Jika kamu ingin melihat atau mendengar," 98 si penakut itu mulai lagi, 99 "Orang Tuscany atau Lombardy, aku akan memanggil mereka;
100 tetapi biarkan para Malebranche minggir sedikit, 101 sehingga mereka tidak takut akan pembalasan dendam mereka; 102 dan aku, yang duduk di tempat ini,
103 untuk satu yang aku lakukan, aku akan memanggil tujuh orang 104 ketika aku bersiul, seperti kebiasaan kami 105 untuk dilakukan ketika seseorang keluar."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
106 Cagnazzo a cotal motto levò ’l muso, 107 crollando ’l capo, e disse: «Odi malizia 108 ch’elli ha pensata per gittarsi giuso!».
query.result:

**Malay:**
106 Cagnazzo mengangkat moncongnya mendengar kata-kata itu, 107 menggelengkan kepala, dan berkata: "Dengarkan kejahatan 108 yang telah dipikirkannya untuk menjatuhkan dirinya ke bawah!"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
109 Ond’ ei, ch’avea lacciuoli a gran divizia, 110 rispuose: «Malizioso son io troppo, 111 quand’ io procuro a’ mia maggior trestizia».
query.result:

109 Whereupon he, who had snares in great abundance, 110 replied: "I am too malicious, 111 when I seek my own greater sorrow".
**Malay:**
109 Di situ, ia yang mempunyai jerat dalam jumlah yang besar, 110 menjawab: "Aku terlalu jahat, 111 ketika aku mencari kesedihan yang lebih besar untuk diriku sendiri".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.

query.result:

115 but I will beat my wings over the pitch.

115 tetapi aku akan mengepakkan sayapku di atas ter.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
116 Lascisi ’l collo, e sia la ripa scudo, 117 a veder se tu sol più di noi vali».
118 O tu che leggi, udirai nuovo ludo: 119 ciascun da l’altra costa li occhi volse, 120 quel prima, ch’a ciò fare era più crudo.
query.result:
**English:**
116 He loosens his neck, and let the bank be a shield, 117 to see if you alone are worth more than us."
118 O you who read, you will hear a new game: 119 each one turned his eyes from the other bank, 120 the first one, who was more cruel to do so.
**Malay:**
116 Dia melepaskan lehernya, dan biarkan tebing menjadi perisai, 117 untuk melihat apakah kamu sendirian lebih berharga daripada kami."
118 Wahai kamu yang membaca, kamu akan mendengar permainan baru: 119 masing-masing mengalihkan pandangannya dari tepi yang lain, 120 yang pertama, yang lebih kejam untuk melakukannya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
121 Lo Navarrese ben suo tempo colse; 122 fermò le piante a terra, e in un punto 123 saltò e dal proposto lor si sciolse.
query.result:
**English:**
121 The Navarrese seized his moment well; 122 he planted his feet on the ground, and in an instant 123 he leaped and freed himself from their proposal.
**Malay:**
121 Orang Navarra itu memanfaatkan waktunya dengan baik; 122 dia menjejakkan kakinya di tanah, dan dalam sekejap 123 dia melompat dan melepaskan diri dari usulan mereka.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
124 Di che ciascun di colpa fu compunto, 125 ma quei più che cagion fu del difetto; 126 però si mosse e gridò: «Tu se’ giunto!».
query.result:
**English:**
124 At which each one was pricked with remorse, 125 but most he who was the cause of the fault; 126 therefore he moved and cried out: "You have arrived!".
**Malay:**
124 Yang mana masing-masing merasa bersalah, 125 tetapi yang paling bersalah adalah dia yang menjadi penyebab kesalahan; 126 oleh karena itu dia bergerak dan berseru: "Kamu telah sampai!".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
127 Ma poco i valse: ché l’ali al sospetto 128 non potero avanzar; quelli andò sotto, 129 e quei drizzò volando suso il petto:
130 non altrimenti l’anitra di botto, 131 quando ’l falcon s’appressa, giù s’attuffa, 132 ed ei ritorna sù crucciato e rotto.
query.result:
**English:**
127 But it availed him little: for his wings of suspicion 128 could not carry him forward; the other went under, 129 and the other, flying, raised his chest:
130 not otherwise the duck, suddenly, 131 when the falcon approaches, dives down, 132 and he returns above, vexed and frustrated.
**Malay:**
127 Tetapi sedikit gunanya: karena sayap kecurigaannya 128 tidak dapat membawanya maju; yang satu pergi ke bawah, 129 dan yang satu lagi, terbang, mengangkat dadanya:
130 tidak lain seperti bebek tiba-tiba, 131 ketika elang mendekat, menukik ke bawah, 132 dan ia kembali ke atas, kesal dan frustrasi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
139 Ma l’altro fu bene sparvier grifagno 140 ad artigliar ben lui, e amendue 141 cadder nel mezzo del bogliente stagno.
query.result:
**English:**
139 But the other was indeed a griffon vulture 140 in seizing him well, and both of them 141 fell into the middle of the boiling pitch.
**Malay:**
139 Tetapi yang satunya lagi memang burung nasar griffon 140 dalam mencengkeramnya dengan baik, dan keduanya 141 jatuh ke tengah-tengah ter yang mendidih.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
142 Lo caldo sghermitor sùbito fue; 143 ma però di levarsi era neente, 144 sì avieno inviscate l’ali sue.
query.result:
**English:**
142 The hot hermit suddenly fled; 143 but he was unable to rise, 144 so gummed were his wings.
**Malay:**
142 Si pertapa yang panas itu tiba-tiba melarikan diri; 143 tetapi dia tidak dapat terbang, 144 karena sayapnya telah dilem.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
145 Barbariccia, con li altri suoi dolente, 146 quattro ne fé volar da l’altra costa 147 con tutt’ i raffi, e assai prestamente
148 di qua, di là discesero a la posta; 149 porser li uncini verso li ’mpaniati, 150 ch’eran già cotti dentro da la crosta.
query.result:
**English:**
145 Barbariccia, grieving with his companions, 146 made four of them fly from the other bank 147 with all their hooks, and very quickly.
148 From this side and that they descended to their posts; 149 they thrust their hooks toward the ensnared, 150 who were already cooked inside their crusts.
**Malay:**
145 Barbariccia, bersedih bersama teman-temannya, 146 membuat empat dari mereka terbang dari tepi yang lain 147 dengan semua pengait mereka, dan dengan sangat cepat.
148 Dari sisi ini dan itu mereka turun ke pos mereka; 149 mereka mendorong pengait mereka ke arah yang terperangkap, 150 yang sudah matang di dalam kerak mereka.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
151 E noi lasciammo lor così ’mpacciati.
query.result:
**English:**
151 And we left them thus entangled.
**Malay:**
151 Dan kami meninggalkan mereka begitu saja dalam keadaan terjerat.
